title: fix: update repository URL in Cargo.toml
body: The repository key in Cargo.toml seemed to be pointing to `cargo-pros` (which redirects to `cargo-v5` anyway); I think it might be being used by `cargo-dist` to generate an incorrect install script.

title: feat: add prebuilt installers
body:
This makes it so you don't have to build from source.

Supports cargo-binstall, homebrew, and a shell one-liner script.

This changes the release process so you need to push a git tag on every release as well as publish to Cargo. A corresponding GitHub Release will be generated using the contents of the changelog.

title: feat: add prebuilt installers
body:
This makes it so you don't have to build from source.

This changes the release process so you need to push a git tag on every release as well as publish to Cargo. A corresponding GitHub Release will be generated using the contents of the changelog.

title: Update nix flake lockfile
body:
This updates all nix dependencies, such as the rust overlay, rust build tooling, and package repository. Most notably, this is necessary because the version of `naersk` being utilized currently (from December of last year) uses an indirect flake reference to `nixpkgs`, which is non-reproducible and breaks evaluation when a system-wide flake registry overrides `nixpkgs` (such as on my system, to ensure only one nixpkgs revision is used system-wide).

In addition, this updates the rust overlay meaning the nightly version of rust was upgraded to today's. I checked to make sure that everything evaluated and compiled, and ended up fixing one error that appeared.

title: fix: ELF `objcopy` section-granularity
body:
https://github.com/vexide/vexide/pull/313 is currently causing binaries produced by `cargo-v5` to skyrocket in size to ~60mb due to the linkerscript covering the entire address range up to `0x08000000`. This shouldn't happen, since those sections in high memory are marked `NOLOAD` in our linkerscript meaning these shouldn't be `SHT_PROGBITS` and therefore shouldn't be loaded into memory by the resulting binary.

Anyways, I've determined that this is a flaw with our current implementation of `objcopy` being too granular and including entire loadable **segments** rather than individual **sections** within those segments. It also means the current implemention doesn't exactly match the behavior of `arm-none-eabi-objcopy` which is really bad. This PR rewrites our implementation to only copy loadable sections into the resulting binary.

This appears to now produce identical output to the binutils generated binaries, but I want to test further before this gets merged.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9629dfc-c6a5-4eb0-b4a6-5e9d19adb18f)

Once this is verified to work, we should get this out into a new version ASAP, since I don't know what further ramifications the whole section vs. segment situation has on soundness.

title: Make version in flake sync with version in Cargo.toml
body:
Updated `build-cargo-v5` in `flake.nix` to set the version of the package to the `Cargo.tml`'s `package.version` property

(The version in the flake was out of date)

body:
Fixes #14.

The license file currently says "(c) 2023 pros-rs", so this PR updates the year and the licensor name.

title: feat: differential uploading
body:
This is the cargo-v5 facing portion of https://github.com/vexide/vexide/pull/269

TODO:
- [x] Compare file CRCs between the base file on the brain and the base file on the host. If they don't match, we need to cold reupload.
- ~~[ ] Cold reupload if the gzipped size of the patch exceeds the gzipped size of the new file.~~ In practice, I think this would take some extreme effort to achieve, so it can be added at a later time.

title: fix: update target to match the latest nightly
body:
vexide doesn't build right now using the latest nightly, so this fixes that. I _think_ I did it correctly? I assume that since the llvm target is armv7a-none-eabi<ins>hf</ins> the V5 brain has an FPU.

The template also needs to be updated, but I can't update that repo directly and so I can't build the tar.

See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/a0dbb3 for why this is needed.

title: fix: :bug: only use directories when needed
body: prevents unresolved import error when `fetch-template` feature is not enabled

title: feat: :sparkles: Use cached template when it is up-to-date
fix: correct buffer size for screenshots
feat: cat, ls, lsdev, rm, log, screenshot
feat: support vexide
body: This PR adds support for building and uploading vexide projects, but keeps around legacy support for pros-rs behind a feature.

title: feat: less improved target file handling
body: This PR moves the target spec location to the crate root (rather than `target/armv7a-vexos-eabi.json`), and only overwrites existing target triples if one already isn't present, allowing modification or the `armv7a-vexos-eabi` target spec per-project if the user wishes.

title: feat: Improved target file
body:
- Enables NEON SIMD instructions on armv7a-vexos-eabi
- Provides several feature flags for dealing with floating point operations faster
- Adds some optional but missing data (such as vendor) to the config.
- Specifies -mcpu type as `cortex-a9`
- Removes dependency on `libm` and `libstdc++`. This will cut off ~50kb of binary size from the resulting monolith.
	- This will require `pros-rs` to use a custom `libpros` static library with the C++ parts stripped out. As such, this will depend on https://github.com/pros-rs/pros-rs/pull/81 to get a working build.

Further optimizations may be possible in the future with more research on custom targets.
